Necesito cubrir gastos médicos. What documentation do I need to provide?

Para retiros por gastos médicos, tendrá que enviar el Form HW-2024-MED junto con copias de facturas médicas que sumen al menos $1,000. Las facturas deben estar fechadas en los últimos 12 meses, and they cannot be covered by insurance.
¿Cuánto tarda el proceso de aprobación una vez que envíe todo?
Por supuesto.
Y de mi balance, what percentage can I actually withdraw?
El retiro máximo está limitado al menor entre $50,000 o el 50% de su balance. En su caso, serían $23,916.07. Additionally, there's a mandatory 20% federal tax withholding sobre el importe bruto.

Para un préstamo máximo de $23,916.07 a 60 meses con el 8.25% APR, su pago mensual sería de $487.23. These payments would be automatically deducted de su nómina empezando el primer período de pago después del desembolso.

Por supuesto. Puedo enviarle el formulario HW-2024-MED ahora mismo a su email registrado que termina en @gmail.com. Una vez completado y devuelto con la documentación, processing typically takes 7-10 business days.
Por favor, envíeme ese formulario. ¿Recibiré confirmación cuando reciban mi solicitud?
Claro que sí.
Una última pregunta. ¿Puedo cambiar de un retiro a un préstamo después de enviarlo?

Sí, puede modificar su solicitud en cualquier momento antes de la aprobación final llamando a nuestro centro de servicio al 1-800-555-4017. Once approved and funds are disbursed, la transacción no se puede revertir. Voy a anotar en su cuenta que podría estar considerando ambas opciones.

original_conversation.content: Good afternoon. I need information about making a hardship withdrawal from my 401k account.
Good afternoon. I'd be happy to assist you with your 401k withdrawal inquiry. May I have your employee ID number and the company name where your plan is administered?
My employee ID is 447829. The company is Midwest Distribution Centers.
Thank you. I've located your account ending in 8294 with a current vested balance of $47,832.15. Before we discuss withdrawal options, may I ask what type of hardship situation you're facing?
I need to cover medical expenses. What documentation do I need to provide?

For medical hardship withdrawals, you'll need to submit Form HW-2024-MED along with copies of medical bills totaling at least $1,000. The bills must be dated within the last 12 months and cannot be covered by insurance.
How long does the approval process take once I submit everything?
Certainly.
And what percentage can I actually withdraw from my vested balance?

The maximum hardship withdrawal is limited to the lesser of $50,000 or 50% of your vested balance. In your case, that would be $23,916.07. Additionally, there's a mandatory 20% federal tax withholding on the gross amount.
That's lower than I expected. Are there other options I should consider?

I understand your concern. You might consider a 401k loan instead, which allows borrowing up to $23,916.07 at a current interest rate of 8.25% APR. The advantage is you'd be repaying yourself rather than taking a permanent distribution.
What would the monthly payments be on a loan of that amount?

For a maximum loan of $23,916.07 over our standard 60-month term at 8.25% APR, your monthly payment would be $487.23. These payments would be automatically deducted from your paycheck starting the first pay period after disbursement.
I appreciate the breakdown. Can I start the withdrawal process today?

Absolutely. I can email you the HW-2024-MED form immediately to your registered email address ending in @gmail.com. Once completed and returned with documentation, processing typically takes 7-10 business days.
Please send that form. Will I receive confirmation once my request is received?
Of course.
One last question. Can I change from a withdrawal to a loan after submitting?

Yes, you can modify your request any time before final approval by calling our service center at 1-800-555-4017. Once approved and funds are disbursed, the transaction cannot be reversed. I'll note your account that you may be considering both options.
